objenome.solver.evolve.init

Class Full

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.solver.evolve.init.Full
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener<ConfigEvent>, GPContainer.GPContainerAware, TypedInitialization, OrganismBuilder<TypedOrganism>

    public class Full
extends java.lang.Object
implements TypedInitialization, Listener<ConfigEvent>, GPContainer.GPContainerAware
    Initialisation method which produces STGPIndividuals with full program trees to a specified depth. Program trees are constructed randomly from the nodes in the syntax, with each node's data-type constraints enforced.

    See the #setup() method documentation for a list of configuration parameters used to control this operator.

    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    Grow, RampedHalfAndHalf

      • Full

        public Full(boolean autoConfig)
        Constructs a FullInitialisation with control parameters initially loaded from the config. If the autoConfig argument is set to true then the configuration will be automatically updated when the config is modified.
        Parameters:
        autoConfig - whether this operator should automatically update its configuration settings from the config

    • Method Detail

      • containsSub

        public static boolean containsSub(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Class<?>> collection,
                                  java.lang.Class<?> cls)

      • setup

        protected void setup(GPContainer config)
        Sets up this operator with the appropriate configuration settings. This method is called whenever a ConfigEvent occurs for a change in any of the following configuration parameters:
        • RandomSequence.RANDOM_SEQUENCE
        • Population.SIZE
        • TypedOrganism.SYNTAX
        • TypedOrganism.RETURN_TYPE
        • TypedOrganism.MAXIMUM_DEPTH
        • TypedInitialization.MAXIMUM_INITIAL_DEPTH
        • OrganismBuilder.ALLOW_DUPLICATES (default: true)

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent(ConfigEvent event)
        Receives configuration events and triggers this fitness function to configure its parameters if the ConfigEvent is for one of its required parameters.
        Specified by:
        onEvent in interface Listener<ConfigEvent>
        Parameters:
        event - the fired event object.

      • createPopulation

        public Population<TypedOrganism> createPopulation(Population<TypedOrganism> survivors,
                                                  GPContainer config)
        Creates a population of new STGPIndividuals from the Nodes provided by the TypedOrganism.SYNTAX config parameter. Each individual is created by a call to the createIndividual method. The size of the population will be equal to the Population.SIZE config parameter. If the OrganismBuilder.ALLOW_DUPLICATES config parameter is set to false then the individuals in the population will be unique according to their equals methods. By default, duplicates are allowed.
        Specified by:
        createPopulation in interface OrganismBuilder<TypedOrganism>
        Returns:
        a population of STGPIndividual objects

      • populate

        public void populate(Population<TypedOrganism> population,
                     int num)
        Specified by:
        populate in interface OrganismBuilder<TypedOrganism>

      • newOrganism

        public TypedOrganism newOrganism()
        Constructs a new STGPIndividual instance with a full program tree composed of nodes provided by the TypedOrganism.SYNTAX config parameter. Each node in the tree is randomly chosen from those nodes with a valid data-type. If the maximum depth has not been reached then the node is only selected from the valid non-terminals and at one less than the maximum depth only the terminals are chosen from.
        Specified by:
        newOrganism in interface OrganismBuilder<TypedOrganism>
        Returns:
        a new individual with a full program tree

      • createTree

        public Node createTree()
        Creates a full program tree to the maximum depth as specified by the getDepth method. The nodes in the tree are randomly chosen from those nodes in the syntax with a data-type that matches the requirements of their parent (or the problem for the root node).
        Returns:
        the root node of the generated program tree
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the method is unable to create valid program trees from the settings supplied

      • isDuplicatesEnabled

        public boolean isDuplicatesEnabled()
        Returns whether or not duplicates are currently allowed in generated populations
        Returns:
        true if duplicates are currently allowed in populations generated by the createPopulation method and false otherwise

      • setDuplicatesEnabled

        public void setDuplicatesEnabled(boolean allowDuplicates)
        Sets whether duplicates should be allowed in populations that are generated. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the OrganismBuilder.ALLOW_DUPLICATES configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        allowDuplicates - whether duplicates should be allowed in populations that are generated

      • getSyntax

        public Node[] getSyntax()
        Returns the array of nodes in the available syntax. Program trees are generated using the nodes in this array.
        Returns:
        an array of the nodes in the syntax

      • setSyntax

        public void setSyntax(Node[] syntax)
        Sets the array of nodes to generate program trees from. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedOrganism.SYNTAX configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        syntax - an array of nodes to generate new program trees from

      • getReturnType

        public java.lang.Class<?> getReturnType()

        Returns:
        the return type of the program trees generated

      • setReturnType

        public void setReturnType(java.lang.Class<?> returnType)
        Sets the required data-type of the program trees generated. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedOrganism.RETURN_TYPE configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        returnType - the data-type of the generated programs

        Parameters:

      • getMaxDepth

        public int getMaxDepth()
        Returns the depth of the program trees generated with this initialisation method
        Returns:
        the depth of the program trees constructed

      • setMaxDepth

        public void setMaxDepth(int maxDepth)
        Sets the depth of the program trees created by the createIndividual method. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedInitialization.MAXIMUM_INITIAL_DEPTH configuration setting on the next config event, or the TypedOrganism.MAXIMUM_DEPTH setting if no initial maximum depth is set.
        Parameters:
        maxDepth - the depth of all program trees generated

      • getRandomSequence

        public RandomSequence getRandomSequence()
        Returns the random number sequence in use
        Returns:
        the currently set random sequence

      • setRandomSequence

        Sets the random number sequence to use. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the RandomSequence.RANDOM_SEQUENCE configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        random - the random number generator to set
